00229         y = static_cast<T>(rhs.y);
00230         return *this;

00240         y = rhs.y;

00243 
00250     T& operator[](int n)
00251     {
00252         assert(n >= 0 && n <= 1);
00253         if (0 == n)
00254             return x;
00255         else
00256             return y;
00257     }
00258

00266     {
00267         assert(n >= 0 && n <= 1);
00268         if (0 == n)
00269             return x;
00270         else
00271             return y;

00436     //--------------[ equality operator ]------------------------
00444     bool operator==(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00445     {
00446         return (std::abs(x - rhs.x) < EPSILON) && (std::abs(y - rhs.y) < EPSILON);
00447     }
00448 
00454     bool operator!=(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00455     {
00456         return !(*this == rhs);
00457     }
00458 
00459     //-------------[ unary operations ]--------------------------
00464     Vector2<T> operator-() const
00465     {
00466         return Vector2<T>(-x, -y);
00467     }
00468 
00469     //-------------[ size operations ]---------------------------
00474     T length() const
00475     {
00476         return (T) std::sqrt(x * x + y * y);
00477     }
00478 
00482     void normalize()
00483     {
00484         T s = length();
00485         x /= s;
00486         y /= s;
00487     }
00488 
00496     T lengthSq() const
00497     {
00498         return x * x + y * y;
00499     }
00500 
00501     //--------------[ misc. operations ]-----------------------
00511     Vector2<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector2<T>& r) const
00512     {
00513         return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;
00514     }
00515 
00516     //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
00522     operator T*()
00523     {
00524         return (T*) this;
00525     }
00531     operator const T*() const
00532     {
00533         return (const T*) this;
00534     }
00535 
00536     //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
00543     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00544     {
00545         lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "]";
00546         return lhs;
00547     }
00548 
00552     std::string toString() const
00553     {
00554         std::ostringstream oss;
00555         oss << *this;
00556         return oss.str();
00557     }
00558 };

00842     Vector3<T> crossProduct(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00843     {
00844         return Vector3<T>(y * rhs.z - rhs.y * z, z * rhs.x - rhs.z * x, x * rhs.y - rhs.x * y);
00845     }

00941     {
00942         return std::fabs(x - rhs.x) < EPSILON && std::fabs(y - rhs.y) < EPSILON && std::fabs(z - rhs.z) < EPSILON;
00943     }

00973     }
00974 
00982     T lengthSq() const

00985     }
00986 
00990     void normalize()
00991     {
00992         T s = length();
00993         x /= s;
00994         y /= s;
00995         z /= s;
00996     }
00997 
00998     //------------[ other operations ]---------------------------
01005     void rotate(T ax, T ay, T az)
01006     {
01007         T a = cos(DEG2RAD(ax));
01008         T b = sin(DEG2RAD(ax));
01009         T c = cos(DEG2RAD(ay));
01010         T d = sin(DEG2RAD(ay));
01011         T e = cos(DEG2RAD(az));
01012         T f = sin(DEG2RAD(az));
01013         T nx = c * e * x - c * f * y + d * z;
01014         T ny = (a * f + b * d * e) * x + (a * e - b * d * f) * y - b * c * z;
01015         T nz = (b * f - a * d * e) * x + (a * d * f + b * e) * y + a * c * z;
01016         x = nx;
01017         y = ny;
01018         z = nz;
01019 
01020     }
01021 
01031     Vector3<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector3<T>& r) const
01032     {
01033         return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;
01034     }
01035 
01036     //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
01037 
01043     operator T*()
01044     {
01045         return (T*) this;
01046     }
01047 
01053     operator const T*() const
01054     {
01055         return (const T*) this;
01056     }
01057 
01058     //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
01065     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector3<T> rhs)
01066     {
01067         lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "," << rhs.z << "]";
01068         return lhs;
01069     }
01070 
01074     std::string toString() const
01075     {
01076         std::ostringstream oss;
01077         oss << *this;
01078         return oss.str();
01079     }
01080 };

01471     Vector4<T>& operator/=(T rhs)
01472     {
01473         x /= rhs;
01474         y /= rhs;
01475         z /= rhs;
01476         w /= rhs;
01477         return *this;
01478     }
01479 
01480     //-------------[ size operations ]---------------------------
01485     T length() const
01486     {
01487         return (T) std::sqrt(x * x + y * y + z * z + w * w);
01488     }
01489 
01493     void normalize()
01494     {
01495         T s = length();
01496         x /= s;
01497         y /= s;
01498         z /= s;
01499         w /= s;
01500     }
01501 
01509     T lengthSq() const
01510     {
01511         return x * x + y * y + z * z + w * w;
01512     }
01513 
01514     //--------------[ misc. operations ]-----------------------
01524     Vector4<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector4<T>& r) const
01525     {
01526         return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;
01527     }
01528 
01529     //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
01530 
01536     operator T*()
01537     {
01538         return (T*) this;
01539     }
01540 
01546     operator const T*() const
01547     {
01548         return (const T*) this;
01549     }
01550 
01551     //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
01558     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector4<T>& rhs)
01559     {
01560         lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "," << rhs.z << "," << rhs.w << "]";
01561         return lhs;
01562     }
01563 
01567     std::string toString() const
01568     {
01569         std::ostringstream oss;
01570         oss << *this;
01571         return oss.str();
01572     }
01573 
01574 };
01575

01579 typedef Vector4<double> Vector4d;
01581 typedef Vector4<int> Vector4i;

01589 template<class T>
01590 class Matrix3
01591 {
01592 public:
01594     T data[9];
01595 
01596     //--------------------------[ constructors ]-------------------------------
01600     Matrix3()
01601     {
01602         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01603             data[i] = (i % 4) ? 0 : 1;
01604     }
01605 
01610     Matrix3(const T * dt)
01611     {
01612         std::memcpy(data, dt, sizeof(T) * 9);
01613     }
01614 
01619     Matrix3(const Matrix3<T>& src)
01620     {
01621         std::memcpy(data, src.data, sizeof(T) * 9);
01622     }
01623 
01628     template<class FromT>
01629     Matrix3(const Matrix3<FromT>& src)
01630     {
01631         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01632         {
01633             data[i] = static_cast<T>(src.data[i]);
01634         }
01635     }
01636 
01640     void identity()
01641     {
01642         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01643             data[i] = (i % 4) ? 0 : 1;
01644     }
01645 
01652     static Matrix3<T> createRotationAroundAxis(T xDeg, T yDeg, T zDeg)
01653     {
01654         T xRads(DEG2RAD(xDeg));
01655         T yRads(DEG2RAD(yDeg));
01656         T zRads(DEG2RAD(zDeg));
01657 
01658         Matrix3<T> ma, mb, mc;
01659         float ac = cos(xRads);
01660         float as = sin(xRads);
01661         float bc = cos(yRads);
01662         float bs = sin(yRads);
01663         float cc = cos(zRads);
01664         float cs = sin(zRads);
01665 
01666         ma.at(1, 1) = ac;
01667         ma.at(2, 1) = as;
01668         ma.at(1, 2) = -as;
01669         ma.at(2, 2) = ac;
01670 
01671         mb.at(0, 0) = bc;
01672         mb.at(2, 0) = -bs;
01673         mb.at(0, 2) = bs;
01674         mb.at(2, 2) = bc;
01675 
01676         mc.at(0, 0) = cc;
01677         mc.at(1, 0) = cs;
01678         mc.at(0, 1) = -cs;
01679         mc.at(1, 1) = cc;
01680 
01681         Matrix3<T> ret = ma * mb * mc;
01682         return ret;
01683     }
01684 
01688     template<class It>
01689     static Matrix3<T> fromOde(const It* mat)
01690     {
01691         Matrix3<T> ret;
01692         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01693         {
01694             for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01695             {
01696                 ret.at(i, j) = static_cast<T>(mat[j * 4 + i]);
01697             }
01698         }
01699         return ret;
01700     }
01701 
01708     template<class FromT>
01709     static Matrix3<T> fromRowMajorArray(const FromT* arr)
01710     {
01711         const T retData[] =
01712         { static_cast<T>(arr[0]), static_cast<T>(arr[3]), static_cast<T>(arr[6]), static_cast<T>(arr[1]),
01713                 static_cast<T>(arr[4]), static_cast<T>(arr[7]), static_cast<T>(arr[2]), static_cast<T>(arr[5]),
01714                 static_cast<T>(arr[8]) };
01715 
01716         return retData;
01717     }
01718 
01725     template<class FromT>
01726     static Matrix3<T> fromColumnMajorArray(const FromT* arr)
01727     {
01728         const T retData[] =
01729         { static_cast<T>(arr[0]), static_cast<T>(arr[1]), static_cast<T>(arr[2]), static_cast<T>(arr[3]),
01730                 static_cast<T>(arr[4]), static_cast<T>(arr[5]), static_cast<T>(arr[6]), static_cast<T>(arr[7]),
01731                 static_cast<T>(arr[8]) };
01732 
01733         return retData;
01734     }

01736     //---------------------[ equiality operators ]------------------------------
01745     bool operator==(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01746     {
01747         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01748         {
01749             if (std::fabs(data[i] - rhs.data[i]) >= EPSILON)
01750                 return false;
01751         }
01752         return true;
01753     }
01754 
01760     bool operator!=(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01761     {
01762         return !(*this == rhs);
01763     }
01764 
01765     //---------------------[ access operators ]---------------------------------
01771     T& at(int x, int y)
01772     {
01773         assert(x >= 0 && x < 3);
01774         assert(y >= 0 && y < 3);
01775         return data[x * 3 + y];
01776     }
01777 
01783     const T& at(int x, int y) const
01784     {
01785         assert(x >= 0 && x < 3);
01786         assert(y >= 0 && y < 3);
01787         return data[x * 3 + y];
01788     }
01789 
01795     T& operator()(int i, int j)
01796     {
01797         assert(i >= 1 && i <= 3);
01798         assert(j >= 1 && j <= 3);
01799         return data[(j - 1) * 3 + i - 1];
01800     }
01801 
01807     const T& operator()(int i, int j) const
01808     {
01809         assert(i >= 1 && i <= 3);
01810         assert(j >= 1 && j <= 3);
01811         return data[(j - 1) * 3 + i - 1];
01812     }
01813 
01818     Matrix3<T>& operator=(const Matrix3<T>& rhs)
01819     {
01820         std::memcpy(data, rhs.data, sizeof(T) * 9);
01821         return *this;
01822     }
01823 
01828     template<class FromT>
01829     Matrix3<T>& operator=(const Matrix3<FromT>& rhs)
01830     {
01831         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01832         {
01833             data[i] = static_cast<T>(rhs.data[i]);
01834         }
01835         return *this;
01836     }
01837 
01842     Matrix3<T>& operator=(const T* rhs)
01843     {
01844         std::memcpy(data, rhs, sizeof(T) * 9);
01845         return *this;
01846     }

01853 
01854     //--------------------[ matrix with matrix operations ]---------------------
01859     Matrix3<T> operator+(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01860     {
01861         Matrix3<T> ret;
01862         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01863             ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs.data[i];
01864         return ret;
01865     }
01866 
01871     Matrix3<T> operator-(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01872     {
01873         Matrix3<T> ret;
01874         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01875             ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs.data[i];
01876         return ret;
01877     }
01878 
01879     //--------------------[ matrix with scalar operations ]---------------------
01884     Matrix3<T> operator+(T rhs) const
01885     {
01886         Matrix3<T> ret;
01887         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01888             ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs;
01889         return ret;
01890     }
01891 
01896     Matrix3<T> operator-(T rhs) const
01897     {
01898         Matrix3<T> ret;
01899         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01900             ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs;
01901         return ret;
01902     }
01903 
01908     Matrix3<T> operator*(T rhs) const
01909     {
01910         Matrix3<T> ret;
01911         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01912             ret.data[i] = data[i] * rhs;
01913         return ret;
01914     }
01915 
01920     Matrix3<T> operator/(T rhs) const
01921     {
01922         Matrix3<T> ret;
01923         for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01924             ret.data[i] = data[i] / rhs;
01925         return ret;
01926     }
01927 
01928     //--------------------[ multiply operators ]--------------------------------
01933     Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
01934     {
01935         return Vector3<T>(data[0] * rhs.x + data[3] * rhs.y + data[6] * rhs.z,
01936                 data[1] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[7] * rhs.z,
01937                 data[2] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[8] * rhs.z);
01938     }
01939 
01944     Matrix3<T> operator*(Matrix3<T> rhs) const
01945     {
01946         static Matrix3<T> w;
01947         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01948         {
01949             for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01950             {
01951                 T n = 0;
01952                 for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++)
01953                     n += rhs.at(i, k) * at(k, j);
01954                 w.at(i, j) = n;
01955             }
01956         }
01957         return w;
01958 
01959     }
01960 
01961     //---------------------------[ misc operations ]----------------------------
01965     Matrix3<T> transpose()
01966     {
01967         Matrix3<T> ret;
01968         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01969         {
01970             for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01971             {
01972                 ret.at(i, j) = at(j, i);
01973             }
01974         }
01975         return ret;
01976     }
01977 
01987     Matrix3<T> lerp(T fact, const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01988     {
01989         Matrix3<T> ret = (*this) + (rhs - (*this)) * fact;
01990         return ret;
01991     }
01992 
01993     T det()
01994     {
01995         return +at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) + at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 0) + at(0, 2) * at(1, 0) * at(2, 1)
01996                 - at(0, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 1) - at(0, 1) * at(1, 0) * at(2, 2) - at(0, 2) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 0);
01997     }
01998 
02003     Matrix3<T> inverse()
02004     {
02005         Matrix3<T> ret;
02006         ret.at(0, 0) = at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) - at(2, 1) * at(1, 2);
02007         ret.at(0, 1) = at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) - at(0, 1) * at(2, 2);
02008         ret.at(0, 2) = at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) - at(1, 1) * at(0, 2);
02009         ret.at(1, 0) = at(2, 0) * at(1, 2) - at(1, 0) * at(2, 2);
02010         ret.at(1, 1) = at(0, 0) * at(2, 2) - at(2, 0) * at(0, 2);
02011         ret.at(1, 2) = at(1, 0) * at(0, 2) - at(0, 0) * at(1, 2);
02012         ret.at(2, 0) = at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) - at(2, 0) * at(1, 1);
02013         ret.at(2, 1) = at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) - at(0, 0) * at(2, 1);
02014         ret.at(2, 2) = at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) - at(1, 0) * at(0, 1);
02015         return ret * (1.0f / det());
02016     }
02017 
02018     //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
02019 
02025     operator T*()
02026     {
02027         return (T*) data;
02028     }
02029 
02035     operator const T*() const
02036     {
02037         return (const T*) data;
02038     }
02039 
02040     //----------[ output operator ]----------------------------
02047     friend std::ostream& operator <<(std::ostream& lhs, const Matrix3<T>& rhs)
02048     {
02049         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02050         {
02051             lhs << "|\t";
02052             for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
02053             {
02054                 lhs << rhs.at(j, i) << "\t";
02055             }
02056             lhs << "|" << std::endl;
02057         }
02058         return lhs;
02059     }
02060 
02064     std::string toString() const
02065     {
02066         std::ostringstream oss;
02067         oss << *this;
02068         return oss.str();
02069     }
02070 };

02085 template<class T>
02086 class Matrix4
02087 {
02088 public:
02090     T data[16];
02091 
02092     //--------------------------[ constructors ]-------------------------------
02096     Matrix4()
02097     {
02098         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02099             data[i] = (i % 5) ? 0 : 1;
02100     }
02101 
02106     Matrix4(const T * dt)
02107     {
02108         std::memcpy(data, dt, sizeof(T) * 16);
02109     }
02110 
02115     Matrix4(const Matrix4<T>& src)
02116     {
02117         std::memcpy(data, src.data, sizeof(T) * 16);
02118     }
02119 
02124     template<class FromT>
02125     Matrix4(const Matrix4<FromT>& src)
02126     {
02127         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02128         {
02129             data[i] = static_cast<T>(src.data[i]);
02130         }
02131     }
02132 
02136     void identity()
02137     {
02138         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02139             data[i] = (i % 5) ? 0 : 1;
02140     }
02141 
02148     static Matrix4<T> createRotationAroundAxis(T xDeg, T yDeg, T zDeg)
02149     {
02150         T xRads(DEG2RAD(xDeg));
02151         T yRads(DEG2RAD(yDeg));
02152         T zRads(DEG2RAD(zDeg));
02153 
02154         Matrix4<T> ma, mb, mc;
02155         float ac = cos(xRads);
02156         float as = sin(xRads);
02157         float bc = cos(yRads);
02158         float bs = sin(yRads);
02159         float cc = cos(zRads);
02160         float cs = sin(zRads);
02161 
02162         ma.at(1, 1) = ac;
02163         ma.at(2, 1) = as;
02164         ma.at(1, 2) = -as;
02165         ma.at(2, 2) = ac;
02166 
02167         mb.at(0, 0) = bc;
02168         mb.at(2, 0) = -bs;
02169         mb.at(0, 2) = bs;
02170         mb.at(2, 2) = bc;
02171 
02172         mc.at(0, 0) = cc;
02173         mc.at(1, 0) = cs;
02174         mc.at(0, 1) = -cs;
02175         mc.at(1, 1) = cc;
02176 
02177         /*std::cout << "RotVec = " << a << "," << b << "," << c << std::endl;
02178          std::cout << "Rx = " << std::endl << ma;
02179          std::cout << "Ry = " << std::endl << mb;
02180          std::cout << "Rz = " << std::endl << mc;*/
02181 
02182         Matrix4<T> ret = ma * mb * mc;
02183         //std::cout << "Result = " << std::endl << ma * (mb * mc);
02184 
02185         return ret;
02186     }
02187 
02189 
02196     static Matrix4<T> createTranslation(T x, T y, T z, T w = 1)
02197     {
02198         Matrix4 ret;
02199         ret.at(3, 0) = x;
02200         ret.at(3, 1) = y;
02201         ret.at(3, 2) = z;
02202         ret.at(3, 3) = w;
02203 
02204         return ret;
02205     }
02206     
02214     static Matrix4<T> createLookAt(const Vector3<T>& eyePos, const Vector3<T>& centerPos, const Vector3<T>& upDir)
02215     {
02216         Vector3<T> forward, side, up;
02217         Matrix4<T> m;
02218 
02219         forward = centerPos - eyePos;
02220         up = upDir;
02221 
02222         forward.normalize();
02223 
02224         // Side = forward x up
02225         side = forward.crossProduct(up);
02226         side.normalize();
02227 
02228         // Recompute up as: up = side x forward
02229         up = side.crossProduct(forward);
02230 
02231         m.at(0, 0) = side.x;
02232         m.at(1, 0) = side.y;
02233         m.at(2, 0) = side.z;
02234 
02235         m.at(0, 1) = up.x;
02236         m.at(1, 1) = up.y;
02237         m.at(2, 1) = up.z;
02238 
02239         m.at(0, 2) = -forward.x;
02240         m.at(1, 2) = -forward.y;
02241         m.at(2, 2) = -forward.z;
02242 
02243         m = m * Matrix4<T>::createTranslation(-eyePos.x, -eyePos.y, -eyePos.z);
02244         return m;
02245     }
02246 
02247 
02260     static Matrix4<T> createFrustum(T left, T right, T bottom, T top, T zNear, T zFar)
02261     {
02262         /*
02263          *
02264           2 zNear
02265         ------------       0              A              0
02266         right - left
02267 
02268                         2 zNear
02269             0         ------------        B              0
02270                       top - bottom
02271 
02272             0              0              C              D
02273 
02274             0              0              -1             0
02275 
02276                                                      A = (right + left) / (right - left)
02277 
02278                                                      B = (top + bottom) / (top - bottom)
02279 
02280                                                     C = - (zFar + zNear) / (zFar - zNear)
02281 
02282                                                     D = - (2 zFar zNear) / (zFar - zNear)
02283          *
02284          */
02285         Matrix4<T> ret;
02286 
02287         const T invWidth = 1.0 / (right - left);
02288         const T invHeight = 1.0 / (top - bottom);
02289         const T invDepth = 1.0 / (zFar - zNear);
02290 
02291         const T twoZNear = 2 * zNear;
02292 
02293         ret.at(0,0) = twoZNear * invWidth;
02294         ret.at(1,1) = twoZNear * invHeight;
02295 
02296         ret.at(2,0) = (right + left) * invWidth;
02297         ret.at(2,1) = (top + bottom) * invHeight;
02298         ret.at(2,2) = - (zFar + zNear) * invDepth;
02299         ret.at(2,3) = -1;
02300 
02301         ret.at(3,2) = - twoZNear * zFar * invDepth;
02302 
02303         return ret;
02304     }
02305 
02318     static Matrix4<T> createOrtho(T left, T right, T bottom, T top, T zNear, T zFar)
02319     {
02320         /*
02321                2
02322         ------------       0              0              tx
02323         right - left
02324 
02325                            2
02326             0         ------------        0              ty
02327                       top - bottom
02328 
02329                                           -2
02330             0              0         ------------        tz
02331                                       zFar-zNear
02332 
02333             0              0              0              1
02334 
02335        where
02336 
02337                                                     tx = - (right + left) / (right - left)
02338 
02339                                                     ty = - (top + bottom) / (top - bottom)
02340 
02341                                                     tz = - (zFar + zNear) / (zFar - zNear)
02342 
02343          */
02344 
02345         const T invWidth = 1.0 / (right  - left);
02346         const T invHeight = 1.0 / (top - bottom);
02347         const T invDepth = 1.0 / (zFar - zNear);
02348 
02349         Matrix4<T> ret;
02350 
02351         ret.at(0,0) = 2 * invWidth;
02352         ret.at(1,1) = 2 * invHeight;
02353         ret.at(2,2) = -2 * invDepth;
02354 
02355         ret.at(3,0) = -(right + left) * invWidth;
02356         ret.at(3,1) = -(top + bottom) * invHeight;
02357         ret.at(3,2) = -(zFar + zNear) * invDepth;
02358 
02359         return ret;
02360     }
02361 
02368     template<class FromT>
02369     static Matrix4<T> fromRowMajorArray(const FromT* arr)
02370     {
02371         const T retData[] =
02372         { static_cast<T>(arr[0]), static_cast<T>(arr[4]), static_cast<T>(arr[8]), static_cast<T>(arr[12]),
02373                 static_cast<T>(arr[1]), static_cast<T>(arr[5]), static_cast<T>(arr[9]), static_cast<T>(arr[13]),
02374                 static_cast<T>(arr[2]), static_cast<T>(arr[6]), static_cast<T>(arr[10]), static_cast<T>(arr[14]),
02375                 static_cast<T>(arr[3]), static_cast<T>(arr[7]), static_cast<T>(arr[11]), static_cast<T>(arr[15]) };
02376 
02377         return retData;
02378     }
02379 
02386     template<class FromT>
02387     static Matrix4<T> fromColumnMajorArray(const FromT* arr)
02388     {
02389         const T retData[] =
02390         { static_cast<T>(arr[0]), static_cast<T>(arr[1]), static_cast<T>(arr[2]), static_cast<T>(arr[3]),
02391                 static_cast<T>(arr[4]), static_cast<T>(arr[5]), static_cast<T>(arr[6]), static_cast<T>(arr[7]),
02392                 static_cast<T>(arr[8]), static_cast<T>(arr[9]), static_cast<T>(arr[10]), static_cast<T>(arr[11]),
02393                 static_cast<T>(arr[12]), static_cast<T>(arr[13]), static_cast<T>(arr[14]), static_cast<T>(arr[15]) };
02394 
02395         return retData;
02396     }
02397 
02398     //---------------------[ Equality operators ]------------------------------
02407     bool operator==(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02408     {
02409         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02410         {
02411             if (std::fabs(data[i] - rhs.data[i]) >= EPSILON
02412                 )
02413                 return false;
02414         }
02415         return true;
02416     }
02417

02424     {
02425         return !(*this == rhs);
02426     }
02427 
02428     //---------------------[ access operators ]---------------------------------
02434     T& at(int x, int y)
02435     {
02436         assert(x >= 0 && x < 4);
02437         assert(y >= 0 && y < 4);
02438         return data[x * 4 + y];
02439     }
02440 
02446     const T& at(int x, int y) const
02447     {
02448         assert(x >= 0 && x < 4);
02449         assert(y >= 0 && y < 4);
02450         return data[x * 4 + y];
02451     }
02452 
02458     T& operator()(int i, int j)
02459     {
02460         assert(i >= 1 && i <= 4);
02461         assert(j >= 1 && j <= 4);
02462         return data[(j - 1) * 4 + i - 1];
02463     }
02464 
02470     const T& operator()(int i, int j) const
02471     {
02472         assert(i >= 1 && i <= 4);
02473         assert(j >= 1 && j <= 4);
02474         return data[(j - 1) * 4 + i - 1];
02475     }
02476 
02482     void setTranslation(const Vector3<T>& v)
02483     {
02484         at(3, 0) = v.x;
02485         at(3, 1) = v.y;
02486         at(3, 2) = v.z;
02487         at(3, 3) = 1;
02488     }
02489 
02490     Vector3<T> getTranslation()
02491     {
02492         return Vector3<T>(at(3, 0), at(3, 1), at(3, 2));
02493     }
02494 
02500     void setRotation(const Matrix3<T>& m)
02501     {
02502         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02503         {
02504             for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
02505             {
02506                 at(i, j) = m.at(i, j);
02507             }
02508         }
02509     }
02510 
02515     Matrix4<T>& operator=(const Matrix4<T>& rhs)
02516     {
02517         std::memcpy(data, rhs.data, sizeof(T) * 16);
02518         return *this;
02519     }
02520 
02525     template<class FromT>
02526     Matrix4<T>& operator=(const Matrix4<FromT>& rhs)
02527     {
02528         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02529         {
02530             data[i] = static_cast<T>(rhs.data[i]);
02531         }
02532         return *this;
02533     }
02534 
02539     Matrix4<T>& operator=(const T* rhs)
02540     {
02541         std::memcpy(data, rhs, sizeof(T) * 16);
02542         return *this;
02543     }
02544 
02545     /*Matrix4<T> & operator=(const double* m)
02546      {
02547      for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++) data[i] = (T)m[i];
02548      return * this;
02549      }*/
02550 
02551     //--------------------[ matrix with matrix operations ]---------------------
02556     Matrix4<T> operator+(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02557     {
02558         Matrix4<T> ret;
02559         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02560             ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs.data[i];
02561         return ret;
02562     }
02563 
02568     Matrix4<T> operator-(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02569     {
02570         Matrix4<T> ret;
02571         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02572             ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs.data[i];
02573         return ret;
02574     }
02575 
02576     //--------------------[ matrix with scalar operations ]---------------------
02581     Matrix4<T> operator+(T rhs) const
02582     {
02583         Matrix4<T> ret;
02584         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02585             ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs;
02586         return ret;
02587     }
02588 
02593     Matrix4<T> operator-(T rhs) const
02594     {
02595         Matrix4<T> ret;
02596         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02597             ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs;
02598         return ret;
02599     }
02600 
02605     Matrix4<T> operator*(T rhs) const
02606     {
02607         Matrix4<T> ret;
02608         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02609             ret.data[i] = data[i] * rhs;
02610         return ret;
02611     }
02612 
02617     Matrix4<T> operator/(T rhs) const
02618     {
02619         Matrix4<T> ret;
02620         for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02621             ret.data[i] = data[i] / rhs;
02622         return ret;
02623     }
02624 
02625     //--------------------[ multiply operators ]--------------------------------
02630     Vector4<T> operator*(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const
02631     {
02632         return Vector4<T>(data[0] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[8] * rhs.z + data[12] * rhs.w,
02633                 data[1] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[9] * rhs.z + data[13] * rhs.w,
02634                 data[2] * rhs.x + data[6] * rhs.y + data[10] * rhs.z + data[14] * rhs.w,
02635                 data[3] * rhs.x + data[7] * rhs.y + data[11] * rhs.z + data[15] * rhs.w);
02636 
02637     }
02638 
02643     Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
02644     {
02645         return Vector3<T>(data[0] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[8] * rhs.z,
02646                 data[1] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[9] * rhs.z,
02647                 data[2] * rhs.x + data[6] * rhs.y + data[10] * rhs.z);
02648     }
02649 
02654     Matrix4<T> operator*(Matrix4<T> rhs) const
02655     {
02656         static Matrix4<T> w;
02657         for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02658         {
02659             for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02660             {
02661                 T n = 0;
02662                 for (int k = 0; k < 4; k++)
02663                     n += rhs.at(i, k) * at(k, j);
02664                 w.at(i, j) = n;
02665             }
02666         }
02667         return w;
02668 
02669     }
02670 
02671     //---------------------------[ misc operations ]----------------------------
02672 
02678     T det()
02679     {
02680 
02681         return +at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3)
02682                 - at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3) + at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3)
02683 
02684         + at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3)
02685                 - at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3) + at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02686 
02687         + at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3) - at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3)
02688                 - at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3) + at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3)
02689 
02690         + at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3) - at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02691                 - at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3) + at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3)
02692 
02693         + at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3) - at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3)
02694                 - at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3) + at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3)
02695 
02696         + at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3) - at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3)
02697                 - at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3) + at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02698 
02699     }
02700 
02707     Matrix4<T> inverse()
02708     {
02709         Matrix4<T> ret;
02710 
02711         ret.at(0, 0) = +at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3) - at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3) + at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3)
02712                 - at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3) - at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3) + at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02713 
02714         ret.at(1, 0) = +at(3, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3) - at(2, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3) - at(3, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3)
02715                 + at(1, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3) + at(2, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3) - at(1, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02716 
02717         ret.at(2, 0) = +at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 3) - at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 3) + at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 3)
02718                 - at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 3) - at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 3) + at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 3);
02719 
02720         ret.at(3, 0) = +at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) - at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) - at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2)
02721                 + at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) + at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) - at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2);
02722 
02723         ret.at(0, 1) = +at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02724                 + at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3) + at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3) - at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02725 
02726         ret.at(1, 1) = +at(2, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(3, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3) + at(3, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02727                 - at(0, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3) - at(2, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3) + at(0, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02728 
02729         ret.at(2, 1) = +at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 3) - at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 3) - at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 3)
02730                 + at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 3) + at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 3) - at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 3);
02731 
02732         ret.at(3, 1) = +at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) - at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) + at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2)
02733                 - at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) - at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) + at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2);
02734 
02735         ret.at(0, 2) = +at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3) + at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02736                 - at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3) - at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3) + at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3);
02737 
02738         ret.at(1, 2) = +at(3, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(1, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(3, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02739                 + at(0, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3) + at(1, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3) - at(0, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3);
02740 
02741         ret.at(2, 2) = +at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 3) - at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 3) + at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 3)
02742                 - at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 3) - at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 3) + at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 3);
02743 
02744         ret.at(3, 2) = +at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) - at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) - at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2)
02745                 + at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) + at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) - at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2);
02746 
02747         ret.at(0, 3) = +at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02748                 + at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3) + at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3) - at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3);
02749 
02750         ret.at(1, 3) = +at(1, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3) - at(2, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3) + at(2, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02751                 - at(0, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3) - at(1, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3) + at(0, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3);
02752 
02753         ret.at(2, 3) = +at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 3) - at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 3) - at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 3)
02754                 + at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 3) + at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 3) - at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 3);
02755 
02756         ret.at(3, 3) = +at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) - at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) + at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2)
02757                 - at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) - at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) + at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2);
02758 
02759         return ret / det();
02760     }
02761 
02765     Matrix4<T> transpose()
02766     {
02767         Matrix4<T> ret;
02768         for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02769         {
02770             for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02771             {
02772                 ret.at(i, j) = at(j, i);
02773             }
02774         }
02775         return ret;
02776     }
02777 
02787     Matrix4<T> lerp(T fact, const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02788     {
02789         Matrix4<T> ret = (*this) + (rhs - (*this)) * fact;
02790         return ret;
02791     }
02792 
02793     //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
02799     operator T*()
02800     {
02801         return (T*) data;
02802     }
02803 
02809     operator const T*() const
02810     {
02811         return (const T*) data;
02812     }
02813 
02814     //----------[ output operator ]----------------------------
02821     friend std::ostream& operator <<(std::ostream& lhs, const Matrix4<T>& rhs)
02822     {
02823         for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02824         {
02825             lhs << "|\t";
02826             for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02827             {
02828                 lhs << rhs.at(j, i) << "\t";
02829             }
02830             lhs << "|" << std::endl;
02831         }
02832         return lhs;
02833     }
02834 
02838     std::string toString() const
02839     {
02840         std::ostringstream oss;
02841         oss << *this;
02842         return oss.str();
02843     }
02844 
02845 };
02846 
02848 typedef Matrix4<float> Matrix4f;
02850 typedef Matrix4<double> Matrix4d;
02852 typedef Matrix4<int> Matrix4i;
02853 
02861 template<class T>
02862 class Quaternion
02863 {
02864 public:
02868     T w;
02872     Vector3<T> v;
02873 
02877     Quaternion()
02878             : w(0), v(0, 0, 0)
02879     {
02880     }
02881 
02885     Quaternion(const Quaternion<T>& q)
02886             : w(q.w), v(q.v)
02887     {
02888     }
02889 
02893     template<class FromT>
02894     Quaternion(const Quaternion<FromT>& q)
02895             : w(static_cast<T>(q.w)), v(q.v)
02896     {
02897     }
02898 
02904     Quaternion(T w_, const Vector3<T>& v_)
02905             : w(w_), v(v_)
02906     {
02907     }
02908 
02916     Quaternion(T w_, T x, T y, T z)
02917             : w(w_), v(x, y, z)
02918     {
02919     }
02920 
02925     Quaternion<T>& operator=(const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02926     {
02927         v = rhs.v;
02928         w = rhs.w;
02929         return *this;
02930     }
02931 
02936     template<class FromT>
02937     Quaternion<T>& operator=(const Quaternion<FromT>& rhs)
02938     {
02939         v = rhs.v;
02940         w = static_cast<T>(rhs.w);
02941         return *this;
02942     }
02943 
02948     Quaternion<T> operator+(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02949     {
02950         const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02951         return Quaternion<T>(lhs.w + rhs.w, lhs.v + rhs.v);
02952     }
02953 
02958     Quaternion<T> operator*(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02959     {
02960         const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02961         return Quaternion<T>(lhs.w * rhs.w - lhs.v.x * rhs.v.x - lhs.v.y * rhs.v.y - lhs.v.z * rhs.v.z,
02962                 lhs.w * rhs.v.x + lhs.v.x * rhs.w + lhs.v.y * rhs.v.z - lhs.v.z * rhs.v.y,
02963                 lhs.w * rhs.v.y - lhs.v.x * rhs.v.z + lhs.v.y * rhs.w + lhs.v.z * rhs.v.x,
02964                 lhs.w * rhs.v.z + lhs.v.x * rhs.v.y - lhs.v.y * rhs.v.x + lhs.v.z * rhs.w);
02965     }
02966 
02971     Quaternion<T> operator*(T rhs) const
02972     {
02973         return Quaternion<T>(w * rhs, v * rhs);
02974     }
02975 
02980     Quaternion<T> operator-(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02981     {
02982         const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02983         return Quaternion<T>(lhs.w - rhs.w, lhs.v - rhs.v);
02984     }
02985 
02990     Quaternion<T>& operator+=(const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02991     {
02992         w += rhs.w;
02993         v += rhs.v;
02994         return *this;
02995     }
02996 
03001     Quaternion<T>& operator-=(const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
03002     {
03003         w -= rhs.w;
03004         v -= rhs.v;
03005         return *this;
03006     }
03007 
03012     Quaternion<T>& operator*=(const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
03013     {
03014         Quaternion q = (*this) * rhs;
03015         v = q.v;
03016         w = q.w;
03017         return *this;
03018     }
03019 
03024     Quaternion<T>& operator*=(T rhs)
03025     {
03026         w *= rhs;
03027         v *= rhs;
03028         return *this;
03029     }
03030 
03038     bool operator==(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
03039     {
03040         const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
03041         return (std::fabs(lhs.w - rhs.w) < EPSILON) && lhs.v == rhs.v;
03042     }
03043 
03049     bool operator!=(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
03050     {
03051         return !(*this == rhs);
03052     }
03053 
03054     //-------------[ unary operations ]--------------------------
03059     Quaternion<T> operator-() const
03060     {
03061         return Quaternion<T>(-w, -v);
03062     }
03063 
03068     Quaternion<T> operator~() const
03069     {
03070         return Quaternion<T>(w, -v);
03071     }
03072 
03077     T length() const
03078     {
03079         return (T) std::sqrt(w * w + v.lengthSq());
03080     }
03081 
03089     T lengthSq() const
03090     {
03091         return w * w + v.lengthSq();
03092     }
03093 
03097     void normalize()
03098     {
03099         T len = length();
03100         w /= len;
03101         v /= len;
03102     }
03103 
03111     static Quaternion<T> fromEulerAngles(T x, T y, T z)
03112     {
03113         Quaternion<T> ret = fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(1, 0, 0), x) * fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(0, 1, 0), y)
03114                 * fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(0, 0, 1), z);
03115         return ret;
03116     }
03117 
03123     static Quaternion<T> fromAxisRot(Vector3<T> axis, float angleDeg)
03124     {
03125         double angleRad = DEG2RAD(angleDeg);
03126         double sa2 = std::sin(angleRad / 2);
03127         double ca2 = std::cos(angleRad / 2);
03128         return Quaternion<T>(ca2, axis * sa2);
03129     }
03130 
03135     Matrix3<T> rotMatrix()
03136     {
03137         Matrix3<T> ret;
03138 
03139         /*ret.at(0,0) = 1 - 2*v.y*v.y - 2*v.z*v.z;
03140          ret.at(1,0) = 2*v.x*v.y - 2*w*v.z;
03141          ret.at(2,0) = 2*v.x*v.z - 2*w*v.y;
03142          
03143          ret.at(0,1) = 2*v.x*v.y + 2*w*v.z;
03144          ret.at(1,1) = 1 - 2*v.x*v.x - 2*v.z*v.z;
03145          ret.at(2,1) = 2*v.y*v.z - 2*w*v.x;
03146          
03147          ret.at(0,2) = 2*v.x*v.z - 2*w*v.y;
03148          ret.at(1,2) = 2*v.y*v.z + 2*w*v.x;
03149          ret.at(2,2) = 1 - 2*v.x*v.x - 2*v.y*v.y;*/
03150 
03151         T xx = v.x * v.x;
03152         T xy = v.x * v.y;
03153         T xz = v.x * v.z;
03154         T xw = v.x * w;
03155 
03156         T yy = v.y * v.y;
03157         T yz = v.y * v.z;
03158         T yw = v.y * w;
03159 
03160         T zz = v.z * v.z;
03161         T zw = v.z * w;
03162 
03163         ret.at(0, 0) = 1 - 2 * (yy + zz);
03164         ret.at(1, 0) = 2 * (xy - zw);
03165         ret.at(2, 0) = 2 * (xz + yw);
03166 
03167         ret.at(0, 1) = 2 * (xy + zw);
03168         ret.at(1, 1) = 1 - 2 * (xx + zz);
03169         ret.at(2, 1) = 2 * (yz - xw);
03170 
03171         ret.at(0, 2) = 2 * (xz - yw);
03172         ret.at(1, 2) = 2 * (yz + xw);
03173         ret.at(2, 2) = 1 - 2 * (xx + yy);
03174 
03175         return ret;
03176     }
03177 
03184     Matrix4<T> transform() const
03185     {
03186         Matrix4<T> ret;
03187 
03188         T xx = v.x * v.x;
03189         T xy = v.x * v.y;
03190         T xz = v.x * v.z;
03191         T xw = v.x * w;
03192 
03193         T yy = v.y * v.y;
03194         T yz = v.y * v.z;
03195         T yw = v.y * w;
03196 
03197         T zz = v.z * v.z;
03198         T zw = v.z * w;
03199 
03200         ret.at(0, 0) = 1 - 2 * (yy + zz);
03201         ret.at(1, 0) = 2 * (xy - zw);
03202         ret.at(2, 0) = 2 * (xz + yw);
03203         ret.at(3, 0) = 0;
03204 
03205         ret.at(0, 1) = 2 * (xy + zw);
03206         ret.at(1, 1) = 1 - 2 * (xx + zz);
03207         ret.at(2, 1) = 2 * (yz - xw);
03208         ret.at(3, 1) = 0;
03209 
03210         ret.at(0, 2) = 2 * (xz - yw);
03211         ret.at(1, 2) = 2 * (yz + xw);
03212         ret.at(2, 2) = 1 - 2 * (xx + yy);
03213         ret.at(3, 2) = 0;
03214 
03215         ret.at(0, 3) = 0;
03216         ret.at(1, 3) = 0;
03217         ret.at(2, 3) = 0;
03218         ret.at(3, 3) = 1;
03219 
03220         return ret;
03221 
03222     }
03223 
03233     Quaternion<T> lerp(T fact, const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
03234     {
03235         return Quaternion<T>((1 - fact) * w + fact * rhs.w, v.lerp(fact, rhs.v));
03236     }
03237 
03241     friend std::ostream& operator <<(std::ostream& oss, const Quaternion<T>& q)
03242     {
03243         oss << "Re: " << q.w << " Im: " << q.v;
03244         return oss;
03245     }
03246 
03250     std::string toString() const
03251     {
03252         std::ostringstream oss;
03253         oss << *this;
03254         return oss.str();
03255     }
03256 
03263     // 2011-07-02: Davide Bacchet: changed formula to fix degenerate cases
03264      static Quaternion<T> fromMatrix(const Matrix4<T>& m)
03265      {
03266         Quaternion<T> q;
03267 
03268         T tr, s;
03269         tr = m(1, 1) + m(2, 2) + m(3, 3);
03270         if (tr >= epsilon)
03271         {
03272             s = 0.5 / (T) sqrt(tr + 1.0);
03273             q.w = 0.25 / s;
03274             q.v.x = (m(3, 2) - m(2, 3)) * s;
03275             q.v.y = (m(1, 3) - m(3, 1)) * s;
03276             q.v.z = (m(2, 1) - m(1, 2)) * s;
03277         }
03278         else
03279         {
03280             T d0 = m(1, 1);
03281             T d1 = m(2, 2);
03282             T d2 = m(3, 3);
03283 
03284             char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2) ? 0 : 2):((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
03285 
03286             if (bigIdx == 0)
03287             {
03288                 s = 2.0 * (T) sqrt(1.0 + m(1, 1) - m(2, 2) - m(3, 3));
03289                 q.w = (m(3, 2) - m(2, 3)) / s;
03290                 q.v.x = 0.25 * s;
03291                 q.v.y = (m(1, 2) + m(2, 1)) / s;
03292                 q.v.z = (m(1, 3) + m(3, 1)) / s;
03293             }
03294             else if (bigIdx == 1)
03295             {
03296                 s = 2.0 * (T) sqrt(1.0 + m(2, 2) - m(1, 1) - m(3, 3));
03297                 q.w = (m(1, 3) - m(3, 1)) / s;
03298                 q.v.x = (m(1, 2) + m(2, 1)) / s;
03299                 q.v.y = 0.25 * s;
03300                 q.v.z = (m(2, 3) + m(3, 2)) / s;
03301             }
03302             else
03303             {
03304                 s = 2.0 * (T) sqrt(1.0 + m(3, 3) - m(1, 1) - m(2, 2));
03305                 q.w = (m(2, 1) - m(1, 2)) / s;
03306                 q.v.x = (m(1, 3) + m(3, 1)) / s;
03307                 q.v.y = (m(2, 3) + m(3, 2)) / s;
03308                 q.v.z = 0.25 * s;
03309             }
03310         }
03311 
03312         return q;
03313     }
03314 
03322      // 2011-07-02: Davide Bacchet: changed formula to fix degenerate cases
03323      static Quaternion<T> fromMatrix(const Matrix3<T>& m)
03324      {
03325         Quaternion<T> q;
03326 
03327         T tr, s;
03328         tr = m(1, 1) + m(2, 2) + m(3, 3);
03329         if (tr >= epsilon)
03330         {
03331             s = 0.5 / (T) sqrt(tr + 1.0);
03332             q.w = 0.25 / s;
03333             q.v.x = (m(3, 2) - m(2, 3)) * s;
03334             q.v.y = (m(1, 3) - m(3, 1)) * s;
03335             q.v.z = (m(2, 1) - m(1, 2)) * s;
03336         }
03337         else
03338         {
03339             T d0 = m(1, 1);
03340             T d1 = m(2, 2);
03341             T d2 = m(3, 3);
03342 
03343             char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2) ? 0 : 2):((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
03344 
03345             if (bigIdx == 0)
03346             {
03347                 s = 2.0 * (T) sqrt(1.0 + m(1, 1) - m(2, 2) - m(3, 3));
03348                 q.w = (m(3, 2) - m(2, 3)) / s;
03349                 q.v.x = 0.25 * s;
03350                 q.v.y = (m(1, 2) + m(2, 1)) / s;
03351                 q.v.z = (m(1, 3) + m(3, 1)) / s;
03352             }
03353             else if (bigIdx == 1)
03354             {
03355                 s = 2.0 * (T) sqrt(1.0 + m(2, 2) - m(1, 1) - m(3, 3));
03356                 q.w = (m(1, 3) - m(3, 1)) / s;
03357                 q.v.x = (m(1, 2) + m(2, 1)) / s;
03358                 q.v.y = 0.25 * s;
03359                 q.v.z = (m(2, 3) + m(3, 2)) / s;
03360             }
03361             else
03362             {
03363                 s = 2.0 * (T) sqrt(1.0 + m(3, 3) - m(1, 1) - m(2, 2));
03364                 q.w = (m(2, 1) - m(1, 2)) / s;
03365                 q.v.x = (m(1, 3) + m(3, 1)) / s;
03366                 q.v.y = (m(2, 3) + m(3, 2)) / s;
03367                 q.v.z = 0.25 * s;
03368             }
03369         }
03370 
03371         return q;
03372     }
03373 
03382     Quaternion<T> slerp(T r, const Quaternion<T>& q2) const
03383     {
03384         Quaternion<T> ret;
03385         T cosTheta = w * q2.w + v.x * q2.v.x + v.y * q2.v.y + v.z * q2.v.z;
03386         T theta = (T) acos(cosTheta);
03387         if (fabs(theta) < epsilon)
03388         {
03389             ret = *this;
03390         }
03391         else
03392         {
03393             T sinTheta = (T) sqrt(1.0 - cosTheta * cosTheta);
03394             if (fabs(sinTheta) < epsilon)
03395             {
03396                 ret.w = 0.5 * w + 0.5 * q2.w;
03397                 ret.v = v.lerp(0.5, q2.v);
03398             }
03399             else
03400             {
03401                 T rA = (T) sin((1.0 - r) * theta) / sinTheta;
03402                 T rB = (T) sin(r * theta) / sinTheta;
03403 
03404                 ret.w = w * rA + q2.w * rB;
03405                 ret.v.x = v.x * rA + q2.v.x * rB;
03406                 ret.v.y = v.y * rA + q2.v.y * rB;
03407                 ret.v.z = v.z * rA + q2.v.z * rB;
03408             }
03409         }
03410         return ret;
03411     }
03412
